newsitem.title: GERMANY: Munich Re sees Amer Re deal complete by end-Nov.
newsitem.headline: Munich Re sees Amer Re deal complete by end-Nov.

text.p: The world's largest reinsurance company, Munich Reinsurance AG, said Monday it expected to complete its takeover of American Reinsurance Co. by the end of the month.
The German company, known as Munich Re, announced plans in August to take over the third-ranked U.S. reinsurer for $3.3 billion.

"We hope that we can complete the acquisition of American Re this month," Munich Re management board chairman Hans-Juergen Schinzler told a news conference. "The unavoidable official process is running so far without any obstacles."
However, Munich Re will not consolidate American Re until the 1997-1998 business year.
Princeton, N.J.-based American Re will merge with Munich Re's Munich American Reinsurance Co. but retain its name.
Reinsurers spread the risk of insurance companies among other investors.
